summary: This is a 'nolle prosequi' filing from the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, recommending the dismissal of the criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein due to his death. The document states that Epstein died on or about August 10, 2019, while the indictment for sex trafficking of minors was pending, necessitating abatement of the case.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was formally charged on July 2, 2019, with conspiracy to commit sex trafficking of minors and sex trafficking of minors.
Epstein died on or about August 10, 2019, while the criminal case was pending and before a final judgment.
The legal principle of abatement, as cited from United States v. Wright, requires the indictment to be dismissed because the defendant died before final judgment.
The document is a formal court filing (nolle prosequi) from August 19, 2019, recommending the dismissal of the case against Epstein due to his death.
The filing was signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman and directed to Judge Richard M. Berman.
